name: Belgrade Fortress
description: A sprawling fortress at the confluence of the Sava and Danube rivers with panoramic city views.

name: Skadarlija Bohemian Quarter
description: Belgrade's charming cobblestone street lined with traditional Serbian restaurants and live music.

name: Old Town Walk
description: Wander through the UNESCO-listed medieval old town with Venetian architecture and hidden squares.

name: San Giovanni Fortress Hike
description: A steep 1,350-step climb to a medieval fortress with breathtaking views over the Bay of Kotor.

name: Skanderbeg Square
description: Tirana's vast central plaza surrounded by government buildings, museums, and the Et'hem Bey Mosque.

name: Bunk'Art Museum
description: A Cold War nuclear bunker converted into a fascinating museum of Albania's communist history.

name: Baščaršija Old Bazaar
description: The Ottoman-era heart of Sarajevo with copper workshops, cafes, and the iconic Sebilj fountain.

name: Tunnel of Hope
description: The wartime tunnel that kept Sarajevo alive during the 1990s siege, now a powerful museum.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: The iconic iron lattice tower offering stunning views of Paris from its observation decks.

name: Louvre Museum
description: The world's largest art museum housing the Mona Lisa and over 35,000 works of art.

name: Montmartre & Sacré-Cœur
description: Bohemian hilltop village crowned by the white-domed basilica with sweeping city panoramas.

name: Colosseum
description: The legendary 2,000-year-old amphitheater where gladiators once battled before 50,000 spectators.

name: Vatican Museums
description: A vast collection of art and antiquities culminating in Michelangelo's breathtaking Sistine Chapel.

name: Trevi Fountain
description: Rome's most famous Baroque fountain where tossing a coin guarantees your return to the Eternal City.

name: Brandenburg Gate
description: The neoclassical triumphal arch that symbolizes German unity and stands at the heart of the city.

name: Museum Island
description: A UNESCO World Heritage complex of five world-class museums on an island in the Spree River.

name: Sagrada Familia
description: Gaudí's unfinished masterpiece basilica with extraordinary organic facades and light-filled interiors.

name: Park Güell
description: A whimsical hilltop park filled with Gaudí's colorful mosaic sculptures and Mediterranean views.

name: Grand Palace
description: The dazzling former royal residence with ornate temples, including the Emerald Buddha.

name: Wat Pho
description: Home to the massive 46-meter reclining Buddha and Thailand's oldest traditional massage school.

name: Chatuchak Weekend Market
description: One of the world's largest outdoor markets with over 15,000 stalls selling everything imaginable.

name: Senso-ji Temple
description: Tokyo's oldest and most significant Buddhist temple with a vibrant shopping street leading to its gates.

name: Shibuya Crossing & Meiji Shrine
description: Experience the world's busiest intersection then escape into the serene forest surrounding Meiji Shrine.

name: TeamLab Borderless
description: An immersive digital art museum where interactive projections flow endlessly across rooms.

name: Hoan Kiem Lake
description: A tranquil lake in the heart of Hanoi with the iconic red Huc Bridge leading to Ngoc Son Temple.

name: Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum
description: The solemn granite mausoleum honoring Vietnam's revolutionary leader, set in Ba Dinh Square.

name: Uluwatu Temple
description: A dramatic clifftop sea temple perched 70 meters above the Indian Ocean, famous for sunset Kecak dance.

name: Tegallalang Rice Terraces
description: Stunning cascading rice paddies carved into the hillside using an ancient Balinese irrigation system.

name: Hagia Sophia
description: A 1,500-year-old architectural marvel that has served as cathedral, mosque, and museum.

name: Grand Bazaar
description: One of the world's oldest covered markets with over 4,000 shops across 61 covered streets.

name: Topkapi Palace
description: The opulent seat of Ottoman sultans for 400 years, housing imperial treasures and the famous Harem.

name: Bosphorus Cruise
description: A scenic ferry ride between two continents passing Ottoman palaces, fortresses, and waterfront mansions.

name: Kaleiçi Old Town
description: A walled old town of narrow Ottoman lanes, Roman ruins, and a picturesque ancient harbor.

name: Düden Waterfalls
description: Spectacular waterfalls cascading directly off sea cliffs into the Mediterranean.

name: Hot Air Balloon Ride
description: Float over fairy chimneys and volcanic valleys at sunrise in one of the world's top balloon experiences.

name: Göreme Open-Air Museum
description: A UNESCO World Heritage site of rock-carved churches with stunning Byzantine frescoes from the 10th century.
